title: UCOMISD â€” Unordered Compare Scalar Double-Precision Floating-Point Values and Set EFLAGS

fields.name: Instruction Modes
fields.value:
`UCOMISD xmm1, xmm2/m64`
`VUCOMISD xmm1, xmm2/m64`
`VUCOMISD xmm1, xmm2/m64{sae}`

fields.name: Description
fields.value: Performs an unordered compare of the double-precision floating-point values in the low quadwords of operand 1 (first operand) and operand 2 (second operand), and sets the ZF, PF, and CF flags in the EFLAGS register according to the result (unordered, greater than, less than, or equal). The OF, SF and AF flags in the EFLAGS register are set to 0. The unordered result is returned if either source operand is a NaN (QNaN or SNaN).

fields.name: ​
fields.value: Operand 1 is an XMM register; operand 2 can be an XMM register or a 64 bit memory

fields.name: ​
fields.value: The UCOMISD instruction differs from the COMISD instruction in that it signals a SIMD floating-point invalid operation exception (#I) only when a source operand is an SNaN. The COMISD instruction signals an invalid numeric exception only if a source operand is either an SNaN or a QNaN.

fields.name: ​
fields.value: The EFLAGS register is not updated if an unmasked SIMD floating-point exception is generated.

fields.name: ​
fields.value: Note: VEX.vvvv and EVEX.vvvv are reserved and must be 1111b, otherwise instructions will #UD.

fields.name: ​
fields.value: Software should ensure VCOMISD is encoded with VEX.L=0. Encoding VCOMISD with VEX.L=1 may encounter unpredictable behavior across different processor generations.

fields.name: C/C++ Intriniscs
fields.value:
`VUCOMISD int _mm_comi_round_sd(__m128d a, __m128d b, int imm, int sae);
`

footer.text: Thanks to Felix Cloutier for the online x86 reference
